content: David Pike | Mathematics and Statistics | Memorial University of Newfoundland Home Our PeopleFacultyDavid Pike David Pike University Research ProfessorCross-appointment to the Dept of Computer Science MAM, PhD Auburn, FTICAB.Math WaterlooMotivational Teaching Award, 2004ICA Hall Medal, 2007 Office: HH-2024Phone: (709) 864-8096Fax: (709) 864-3010 dapike@mun.ca Personal website Dr. Pike joined the faculty at Memorial University in September 1998 and has subsequently taught courses in cryptography, graph theory, mathematical computing, and other subjects. Dr. Pike has held a research grant from NSERC to study problems in combinatorial design theory and graph theory since 1999 and has also received grants from CFI and NSERC for high performance computing equipment. His research has involved colourings of cycle systems and designs, structural properties of block-intersection graphs of combinatorial designs, existential closure of graphs, as well as computational problems in combinatorics. Dr. Pike is currently a Vice-President of the Institute of Combinatorics and its Applications, and recently served as a Vice-President of the Canadian Mathematical Society.
